sentence.Network_en: It would be disingenuous to claim that this is great art.

sentence.Network_en: It would be disingenuous of me to claim I had never seen it.
sentence.Network_cn: 要说我从未看到过，那就是言不由衷了。

sentence.Network_en: It is disingenuous of him to flatter me.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对我阿谀奉承,是居心叵测.

list.abs: More than that he seems disingenuous ; in fact , his smile looks phony too ., 更有甚者 , 他似乎并无诚意 , 事实上 , 他的笑容也显得虚伪.
disingenuouslydisingenuousness disinherit 失继承权disinheritance disintegrate 分解分裂分化瓦解破裂崩溃粉碎分.
To attribute that entirely to Mr Obama would be disingenuous ., 把这完全归咎于奥巴马是不诚实的.

entry.tran: 不诚恳的;不坦率的;狡猾的
entry.def: Someone who is disingenuous is slightly dishonest and insincere in what they say.

example.ex: It would be disingenuous to claim that this is great art.
example.tran: 称这是艺术瑰宝是言不由衷。

means.word_mean: 1. not straightforward or candid; giving a false appearance of frankness;

sentences.sentence: "an ambitious, disingenuous, philistine, and hypocritical operator, who...exemplified...the most disagreeable traits of his time"- David Cannadine
